at.irian.ankor.context

Interface ModelContext


  • public interface ModelContext
    The ModelContext provides access to all information that belongs to one specific model instance. It represents the model instance during runtime. Every ModelContext has a unique identifier that identifies the model. Besides that the ModelContext provides access to the event listeners of the model and one or more "model roots".
    Author:
    Manfred Geiler

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns:
        the unique identifier of the corresponding model

      • getEventListeners

        EventListeners getEventListeners()
        Returns:
        the event listeners of this model

      • getModelRoot

        Object getModelRoot(String rootName)
        Parameters:
        rootName - name of the model root variable
        Returns:
        the root object with the given variable name or null if no such root object exists

      • setModelRoot

        void setModelRoot(String rootName,
                Object modelRoot)
        Adds a new model root object.
        Parameters:
        rootName - name of the model root variable
        modelRoot - root of the object tree to be added to the model

      • close

        void close()
        Close this model and free all resources. After a model is closed, the framework is free to cleanup all resources that might have been used by this model. ModelContext implementations should close the associated EventDispatcher(s) and omit all references to model root instances.

      • getAttributes

        Map<String,Object> getAttributes()
        Get a custom attributes map that may be used by Ankor extensions. Extensions, that want to store custom attributes for a model, must take care that the map key they use is unique.
        Returns:
        custom attributes map

      • getEventDispatcher

        EventDispatcher getEventDispatcher()
        Returns:
        the event dispatcher that is currently used for this model

      • pushEventDispatcher

        void pushEventDispatcher(EventDispatcher eventDispatcher)
        Replace the currently used EventDispatcher by the given EventDispatcher. The current dispatcher is put on a stack and may later be restored by a call to popEventDispatcher().
        Parameters:
        eventDispatcher - the new EventDispatcher

      • popEventDispatcher

        EventDispatcher popEventDispatcher()
        Omit the current EventDispatcher and restore the previously used EventDispatcher for this model.
        Returns:
        the restored EventDispatcher
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no previous EventDispatcher
